tool_purpose: Calculates fluid velocity inside a pipe based on flow rate and pipe diameter.

inputs.label: Flow Rate
inputs.explanation: The volumetric flow rate of the fluid.

inputs.label: Pipe Inner Diameter
inputs.explanation: The internal diameter of the pipe.

outputs.label: Fluid Velocity
outputs.description: Velocity of fluid flowing inside the pipe.

assumptions: No frictional or entrance losses are considered.

seo.meta_description: Calculate fluid velocity in a pipe using flow rate and internal diameter.

tool_notes.title: How this calculator works
tool_notes.text: Velocity is calculated by dividing volumetric flow rate by the pipeâ€™s cross-sectional area.

tool_notes.title: When to use this calculator
tool_notes.text: Use this tool when designing plumbing systems to ensure flow velocity stays within acceptable limits.
